name: ToddyCat APT Techniques
description: Mapping of the techniques used by ToddyCat

techniques.comment: ToddyCat used a tool called "cuthead" to search for documents on the infected system
The ToddyCat group has a tool to extract cookies and passwords from Chrome and Edge
ToddyCat used the System.IO.Compression.ZipFile module to pack collected data into a ZIP archive
The attackers used the System.IO.Compression.ZipFile module to create ZIP archives for moving the data
The APT group transferred tools to target hosts via SMB
To evade detection, the malicious group encrypted the data transmitted through a tool they used called "Krong"
Various files were packed into an archive for exfiltration
ToddyCat group used OpenSSH private key files to establish a connection to the remote server
Part of the command and control process involved creating an SSH tunnel to a remote server
A tool called "Krong" was side-loaded with a legitimate application
